page.title: 20St. Mary Magdelene, Exford.
page.content: The church is at the top of the hill. It has a grave yard in which stands the remains of an old stone cross where people used to meet.The church is built of local stone.It has a tower with a spiral stair case which is probably the oldest part of the building (500 yrs old).On the tower is a clock,and inside are 6 bells.About 200 people could fit in the pews.There are hymn books for singing with the organ.The screen came from St Audries and was found in a barn.After restoration,cleaning and measurement Exford was the only church it fitted.In winter the church is heated and electric lights are used in the evenings.Our Rector has 4 churches in his care,so there is only 1 service a week on Sundays.There are also marriages, baptisms and burials conducted at church.
